data.title: Wabishabi (1988)
data.meta_description: Director Noboru Iguchi's first 8mm film, which he shot as a high school student.
data.text:
This short was from a rare DVD compilation of early Noboru Iguchi short films. All five shorts are compiled on a single upload.

Watch or download here (Japanese language, no subtitles): archive.org/details/noboru-iguchi-short-films

Iguchi's most common trait throughout these shorts is chaos - and I can't just attribute the confusing storytelling to my lack of understanding Japanese, they are just very abstract and undisciplined in terms of style and structure. I will make a few comments that are relevant to most or all of these shorts:

- I love Iguchi's approach to the human face and how people and characters relate to the camera. It's a very intrusive, intimate kind of style that's a nice grounding feature throughout.

- I foundâ€¦
